body.name: Love's Blind Embrace: A Historical Western Romance Novel

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Life in a small town has its challenges
reviews.reviewText: Rosa and her family owned a farm until something terrible happened and was left disfigured and alone except for Tom who wa sa friend of the family who stepped in to parent her.Clay had a falling out with his family and left home and he met William who was selling a snake-oil like product when they arrive in Rosa's town.. Clay is deaf in one ear but a wonder at finding water on properties where they needed clean and clear water.In the past, Rosa's mother had been courted by Vincent, who would not take no for an answer. Anita found a caring man and married him instead.It appears that one of the creeks in town is being poisoned. Will they find a way to verify that there was arsenic in the water?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This story begins in Pine Ridge; Colorado during 1888 drought contains lots of intrigue. Bandits struck Rosa’s home when she was young killing her family and to leave her with only vision in one eye. Only friend Rosa has in town is Lila. Lila’s comment to Rosa about the town “most folks round here are nice from afar, but far from nice.” Certainly, telling not only the hearsay about Rosa, but also about Clay when he arrives in town with his business partner, William. Something drew Clay to the area he wasn’t sure if that is about the water or Rosa. Clay’s statement to Rosa “My world would be poorer without meeting you.” Rosa is drawn to Clay love grows.Pine Ridge is site of murkiness about prior events in the town leading to lots of superstitions, poisonous water, Victor Harland’s role in it and how Rosa and Clay join to discover the truth. This is a clean, old West historical romance with suspense and mystery added in with an interesting ending.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Once I got started on this book, I couldn't put it down. Difficult circumstances and superstitions hit head-on in this story making Rosa's life miserable and lonely. She can't even go to town without people calling her names and mumbling prayers to ward off the curses they are convinced she can cast. However, she isn't the only one they focus their attention on. When a water diviner comes to town, attention is diverted to him and when the people in town begin to get sick, accusations start to fly. It looks like the only way to solve the problem is to enlist the help of an unlikely ally and in the process solve the mystery of what happened in the town many years ago.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Rosa lives on a ranch on the outskirts of town with Tom her father figure as her family was killed by bandits when she was14. She was hurt badly and ended up losing her eye. There is currently a very bad drought going on and Clay comes to town. He is a water deviner. They become close and discover that the townspeople are being poisoned by the water in the near by creek. They take on trying to find the answers to the water problems and discover that they are in love. Great story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A good clean Western, well worth $1.00.No typos a plus.However, a bit drawn out unnecessarily and a bit too much focus on Risas' eye/scar. I am sure that due to the lack of good medicine and hospitals...quite a few folks back then had : scars, mangled/missing limbs, etc.But overall, a nice story.3 1/2- 4 stars.Plenty of pages to spend a Chilly Winter night with.Recommended :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good morals, interesting cast
reviews.reviewText: Pace drags at times, especialy at the end and epilogue. No reason to suspect heroine would have a brother an be reunited with him. Left more questions than answers.In chapter 24, a misprint of Jessie in sentence, This Jesie Harland ...Quotes that spoke to this reader.Chapter 12 Sadness you can deal with. It stops having an edge...But fear is always fresh and new and burns. It is the fear that would hold her back until she can face the issue.She eventually did face her fears.Chapter 24 The only way that terrible things happen is for good men to stand idly by wit their hands in their pockets.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Survival of the fittest
reviews.reviewText: Rosa is is blind in one eye and ostracized by the town, Clay is a water diviner trying to find water for the town. Secrets are lurking everywhere, will they be able to win over the town so their love can flourish?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love's Blind Embrace
reviews.reviewText: A good and wonderful story about a young woman named Rosa that lost her eye when a evil person attacked her family and killed all but her The town wad unfair and called her A witch but someone loved her and she found love and happiness and family
Highly recommend this book by a great author
